channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Teachers decry AI as brain-rotting junk food for kids: ‘Students can’t reason. They can’t think. They can’t solve problems’
item.description: The findings come from a major, yearlong “premortem” conducted by the Brookings Institution’s Center for Universal Education.

item.title: Desperate job seekers are abandoning the idea of a ‘dream job’—but an economist warns bosses about what could happen next
item.description: More than a quarter of new employees took a pay cut, showing that bosses hold the power.

item.title: Despite a $45 million net worth, Big Bang Theory star still works tough, 16-hour days—he repeats one mantra when overwhelmed
item.description: Even with a $45 million net worth, fame, and a dream career, Big Bang Theory star Kunal Nayyar still has tough days. Just like Jeff Bezos and Melinda ...

item.title: AI will infiltrate the industrial workforce in 2026—let’s apply it to training the next generation, not replacing them
item.description: A silent crisis is shaking the very foundations of modern society. Here's how to turn it into a loud victory.

item.title: America’s $952 billion annual burden: Exploding interest on national debt is set to surpass Medicare spending within the decade
item.description: The staggering math behind the rapid rise in interest due on our outsized debt.

item.title: Silver's getting more expensive to trade, but it may still hit $100. Here’s how.
